comment.author: 18619970@N00
comment._content: I used to sled down that slope behind the parking lot when I was a little kid!

comment.author: 83979593@N00
comment._content: I love it!  We see people who live on Eastern Parkway taking their dogs over there to run around a bunch - they love that slope!  Nice to hear from you again, otherthings!  With both you and Irene commenting it feels like old home week here :)  Have a great New Year!  -shelley

comment.author: 44731447@N00
comment._content: Very nice !  I took some great pictures at the Botanical Gardens. It's nice to see it from this perspective.  Have a great New Year!  One of my resolutions is to make it to the Brooklyn Museum at least once in 2009!  Seeing all the great things on your flickr account deepens my resolve to do this!  Fred

comment.author: 83979593@N00
comment._content: colbalt in CT - awesome, love hearing that...might hold you to it :)  ~shelley

comment._content: An amazing view, so beautiful covered in snow

comment._content: Beautiful capture absolutely lovely ! Well done!! Thank you for your Encouragements............

comment.author: 99687692@N00
comment._content: I just moved to Portland, Oregon from Park Slope.  You can have some of our snow.  It just keeps coming!  And they don't have plows here, so the city shuts down!

comment.author: 83979593@N00
comment._content: wow, that's crazy!  we had the age-old new york problem:  it snowed, then it rained (but the temp didn't rise enough to get rid of the first snow), then the temp dropped and we were all ice-skating to work this morning.  argh!  ~shelley
